strategy.trend_analysis: Leverages the current trend of educational content on Instagram (#LearnOnInstagram, #Edutainment) and the popularity of meme-based learning (#MathMeme, #MemeEducation). Includes general engagement drivers like #MindBlown and #CommentBelow. Incorporates specific mathematical terms for niche audience targeting.
strategy.engagement_strategy: A mix of broad and niche hashtags increases discoverability. Primary and trending hashtags draw in a wider audience, while niche hashtags attract a more targeted, engaged group. Engagement hashtags like #ShareYourKnowledge and #CommentBelow are direct calls to action designed to foster community interaction and increase the post's visibility through algorithmic boosts.

usage_tips: For Instagram, aim to use a mix of popular and more specific hashtags in your caption or the first comment. Don't overload the caption; distribute them strategically.
Consider rotating your hashtags for different posts to continuously reach new audiences and test which combinations perform best.
Engage with users who use your hashtags or comment on your posts to build a stronger community.
Always check Instagram's trending topics and hashtag performance to stay current and adapt your strategy.

generation_metadata.topic: Family Guy cutaway: Baby dragon climbing infinite staircase! 'Monotonic means always up or always down!' Bounded + monotonic = convergent! 'No falling off!' Recursive sequences: Dragon caught in time loop! 'Next term depends on previous!' Finding limits of recursive sequences. The number e appears: 'Natural dragon growth!' Cantor's lemma: Nested dragon boxes! Subsequences are dragon cousins. Bolzano-Weierstrass: 'Every bounded sequence has a convergent cousin!'
